BIO

Bryan Diaz is the founder of BAD Yoga, a space for people to stay curious and connect with their physical and emotional bodies. This passion project started after he completed a two hundred hour yoga teacher certification program in Rishikesh, India. His aim was to deepen his ten-year practice. This program augemented his understanding of yogic philosophy, a crucial component that is absent in U.S.A. yoga spaces, which he decided to share with the world via BAD Yoga, which is named after his own intials.

Bryan is native to San Antonio, Texas. He is an Armand Hammer United World College (UWC-USA) alum and he studied Chinese and Dance at St. Olaf College. As a recent New Haven transplant, he enjoys exploring new beaches along the east coast. In his down time, he studies Russian and maintains his Spanish, French, and Mandarin.
